content: Who won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1923, becoming the first Irishman to receive this honor?

The Nobel Prize in Literature in 1923 was awarded to William Butler Yeats, making him the first Irishman to receive this honor. Yeats was a prominent figure in the Irish Literary Revival and is remembered as one of the greatest poets of the 20th century. His works often explored Irish mythology and folklore, and he was also involved in the founding of the Abbey Theatre in Dublin.
